questions.question: Choose the correct form: La mesa _____ (blanco)
questions.explanation: Mesa is feminine singular, so the adjective must be 'blanca' (feminine singular).

questions.question: Select the correct form: Los libros _____ (rojo)
questions.explanation: Libros is masculine plural, so the adjective becomes 'rojos' (masculine plural).

questions.question: Complete: Las chicas _____ (alto)
questions.explanation: Chicas is feminine plural, so the adjective must be 'altas' (feminine plural).

questions.question: Choose the correct form: El perro _____ (pequeño)
questions.explanation: Perro is masculine singular, so the adjective remains 'pequeño' (masculine singular).

questions.question: Select: Una casa _____ (grande)
questions.explanation: Adjectives ending in -e don't change for gender, only number. Casa is singular, so 'grande'.

questions.question: Complete: Los estudiantes _____ (inteligente)
questions.explanation: Adjectives ending in -e add -s for plural. Estudiantes is plural, so 'inteligentes'.

questions.question: Choose: Las flores _____ (azul)
questions.explanation: Adjectives ending in consonants add -es for plural. Flores is plural, so 'azules'.

questions.question: Select the correct form: El examen _____ (fácil)
questions.explanation: Adjectives ending in consonants don't change for gender. Examen is singular, so 'fácil'.

questions.question: Complete: Unos problemas _____ (difícil)
questions.explanation: Problemas is masculine plural. Adjectives ending in consonants add -es for plural: 'difíciles'.

questions.question: Choose: La profesora _____ y _____ (joven, simpático)
questions.explanation: Profesora is feminine singular. 'Joven' doesn't change for gender, but 'simpático' becomes 'simpática'.

questions.question: Select: Los coches _____ y _____ (nuevo, caro)
questions.explanation: Coches is masculine plural. Both adjectives need masculine plural endings: 'nuevos y caros'.

questions.question: Complete: Las ciudades _____ (español)
questions.explanation: Ciudades is feminine plural. The adjective 'español' becomes 'españolas' (feminine plural).

questions.question: Choose: Un problema _____ (serio)
questions.explanation: Despite ending in -a, 'problema' is masculine singular, so the adjective is 'serio'.

questions.question: Select: Las manos _____ (limpio)
questions.explanation: Manos is feminine plural, so the adjective becomes 'limpias' (feminine plural).

questions.question: Complete: El agua _____ (frío)
questions.explanation: Despite using 'el', agua is feminine. The adjective must agree: 'fría' (feminine singular).

questions.question: Choose: Los días _____ (feliz)
questions.explanation: Días is masculine plural. Adjectives ending in -z change to -ces in plural: 'felices'.

questions.question: Select: Una actriz _____ (famoso)
questions.explanation: Actriz is feminine singular, so the adjective becomes 'famosa' (feminine singular).

questions.question: Complete: Los animales _____ (salvaje)
questions.explanation: Animales is plural. Adjectives ending in -e add -s for plural: 'salvajes'.

questions.question: Choose: Las niñas _____ y _____ (travieso, divertido)
questions.explanation: Niñas is feminine plural. Both adjectives need feminine plural endings: 'traviesas y divertidas'.

questions.question: Select: El clima _____ (tropical)
questions.explanation: Clima is masculine singular. Adjectives ending in consonants don't change for gender: 'tropical'.
